intro: Moehringia trinervia subsp. pentandra, commonly known as the five-veined moehringia, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States. This species is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments.
